Label: has country
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: has location
Contributors: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

Label: has third country
Definition: Indicates applicability or relevance of a 'third country'
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: is outside of location
Definition: Indicates the interpretation where the location being referenced is outside of the indicated concept
Usage: This property is helpful for cases where a distinction needs to be made between inside/outside of a concept, and the area outside of that concept is to be referenced. For example, using Home with dpv:hasLocation means inside the Home, and using this property along with Home means outside of Home - such as the yard or porch
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog, Julian Flake

Label: has inverse jurisdiction
Definition: Indicates the inverse jurisdiction for a given jurisdiction
Usage: Using this property gives the set of all other jurisdictions that are not part of the jurisdiction e.g. when used with a country, it refers to all other countries
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog, Julian Flake
